title: Plant Guilds and Companion Planting in Timor-Leste Quiz

questions.question: What is a plant guild?
choices: A group of plants that work together and support each other
A group of plants that compete with each other for resources
A type of plant that only grows in Timor-Leste
A method of planting crops in straight rows
questions.answer: A group of plants that work together and support each other

questions.question: What is companion planting?
choices: The practice of planting different crops together for mutual benefits
The practice of planting only one type of crop in a field
The practice of planting crops in a greenhouse
The practice of planting crops without any planning or design
questions.answer: The practice of planting different crops together for mutual benefits

questions.question: Why are plant guilds and companion planting important in sustainable agriculture?
choices: They promote biodiversity, pest control, and efficient use of resources
They require more chemical inputs and labor than monocultures
They are only suitable for large-scale industrial farms
They have no significant benefits over traditional monoculture practices
questions.answer: They promote biodiversity, pest control, and efficient use of resources

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of complementary nutrient needs in a plant guild?
choices: Legumes fixing nitrogen for other plants
All plants competing for the same nutrients
Plants releasing toxins to inhibit the growth of other plants
Plants with shallow roots blocking the growth of deep-rooted plants
questions.answer: Legumes fixing nitrogen for other plants

questions.question: What is the benefit of having plants with different heights (vertical layering) in a guild?
choices: It maximizes the use of space and resources
It makes the garden look more aesthetically pleasing
It prevents the plants from interacting with each other
It makes the plants more susceptible to pests and diseases
questions.answer: It maximizes the use of space and resources

questions.question: How can plant guilds help with pest and disease management?
choices: By creating habitats for beneficial insects that prey on pests
By attracting more pests to the garden
By making the plants more susceptible to diseases
By requiring the use of more chemical pesticides
questions.answer: By creating habitats for beneficial insects that prey on pests

questions.question: What is the role of some plants in improving soil health within a guild?
choices: They add organic matter and nutrients to the soil
They deplete the soil of all nutrients
They make the soil more compacted and hard to work with
They have no effect on soil health
questions.answer: They add organic matter and nutrients to the soil

questions.question: How can plant guilds create beneficial microclimates?
choices: By providing shade, windbreaks, or humidity regulation
By creating extreme temperature fluctuations
By promoting soil erosion and water runoff
By inhibiting the growth of all other plants around them
questions.answer: By providing shade, windbreaks, or humidity regulation

questions.question: What is the traditional 'Three Sisters' companion planting combination?
choices: Corn, beans, and squash
Tomatoes, peppers, and eggplants
Carrots, onions, and lettuce
Potatoes, wheat, and barley
questions.answer: Corn, beans, and squash

questions.question: In a fruit tree guild, what is the role of lemongrass (Duut-morin)?
choices: To repel pests and provide a pleasant scent
To fix nitrogen in the soil for the fruit trees
To climb up the fruit trees for support
To compete with the fruit trees for sunlight
questions.answer: To repel pests and provide a pleasant scent

questions.question: What is the benefit of planting marigolds (Klaor) with tomatoes?
choices: Marigolds repel pests like nematodes that attack tomato roots
Marigolds attract more tomato pests to the garden
Marigolds compete with tomatoes for nutrients in the soil
Marigolds have no effect on tomato growth or health
questions.answer: Marigolds repel pests like nematodes that attack tomato roots

questions.question: How can pigeon peas (Tunis) help eggplants (Brinjela) in a companion planting system?
choices: Pigeon peas fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting the eggplants
Pigeon peas shade the eggplants from too much sun
Pigeon peas attract eggplant pests away from the crop
Pigeon peas have no beneficial effect on eggplant growth
questions.answer: Pigeon peas fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting the eggplants

questions.question: How do plant guilds help with water retention in Timor-Leste's dry season?
choices: The diverse plant cover helps shade the soil and reduce evaporation
The plants compete with each other for the limited water, making them more drought-resistant
The plants channel water away from the soil, preventing waterlogging
Plant guilds have no significant impact on water retention in the soil
questions.answer: The diverse plant cover helps shade the soil and reduce evaporation

questions.question: How can plant guilds enhance soil fertility in Timor-Leste's poor soils?
choices: By including nitrogen-fixing legumes and nutrient-accumulating plants
By promoting soil erosion and nutrient leaching
By requiring the use of more chemical fertilizers
By making the soil more acidic and less fertile
questions.answer: By including nitrogen-fixing legumes and nutrient-accumulating plants

questions.question: Why are plant guilds and companion planting particularly useful for natural pest control in Timor-Leste?
choices: Many farmers have limited access to commercial pesticides
Pests are not a significant problem in Timor-Leste's agriculture
Chemical pesticides are more effective than natural pest control methods
Farmers in Timor-Leste prefer to use chemical pesticides over natural methods
questions.answer: Many farmers have limited access to commercial pesticides

questions.question: How can plant guilds increase overall productivity in small land areas?
choices: By maximizing the use of vertical space and resources
By reducing the number of plants that can be grown in a given area
By requiring more land to be dedicated to each crop
By promoting the growth of weeds and undesired plants
questions.answer: By maximizing the use of vertical space and resources

questions.question: How do plant guilds and companion planting help preserve biodiversity in Timor-Leste?
choices: By promoting the use of diverse, traditional crop varieties
By encouraging the planting of only a few high-yielding varieties
By replacing native plants with introduced, exotic species
By promoting the use of genetically modified crops
questions.answer: By promoting the use of diverse, traditional crop varieties

questions.question: What is the purpose of discussing traditional Timorese polyculture systems in this lesson?
choices: To learn from local ecological knowledge and practices
To discourage the use of traditional farming methods
To promote the adoption of modern, industrial agriculture
To criticize the inefficiency of traditional polyculture systems
questions.answer: To learn from local ecological knowledge and practices

questions.question: What is the goal of the hands-on activity in this lesson?
choices: To apply the principles of plant guilds to design a Timorese garden
To practice planting crops in monoculture rows
To learn how to use chemical pesticides and fertilizers
To compete with other groups for the best garden design
questions.answer: To apply the principles of plant guilds to design a Timorese garden

questions.question: What is one challenge in implementing plant guilds and companion planting in Timor-Leste?
choices: Balancing traditional practices with new techniques
Lack of available land for planting diverse crops
Absence of beneficial insects in the local ecosystem
Inability of local farmers to understand complex plant interactions
questions.answer: Balancing traditional practices with new techniques

questions.question: How might climate change impact the use of plant guilds in Timor-Leste?
choices: Changing weather patterns may require adaptation of plant selections and combinations
Climate change will have no effect on plant guilds and companion planting
Warmer temperatures will make plant guilds easier to manage
Climate change will eliminate the need for companion planting
questions.answer: Changing weather patterns may require adaptation of plant selections and combinations

questions.question: What is a potential challenge in marketing crops from plant guilds?
choices: Some buyers may prefer single-crop products over diverse harvests
Plant guilds always produce higher yields than monocultures
Companion planting is not compatible with commercial agriculture
Diverse crops are easier to harvest and process than monocultures
questions.answer: Some buyers may prefer single-crop products over diverse harvests

questions.question: Why might managing plant guilds require more labor than monocultures?
choices: Diverse plantings may need more individualized attention and care
Plant guilds require less weeding and pest control than monocultures
Harvesting multiple crops is always less time-consuming than harvesting a single crop
Companion planting eliminates the need for any crop maintenance
questions.answer: Diverse plantings may need more individualized attention and care

questions.question: What is the main objective of the student assignment?
choices: To learn about traditional companion planting practices from local experts
To convince farmers to abandon traditional practices in favor of modern methods
To gather data on the ineffectiveness of polyculture systems
To discourage the use of plant guilds and companion planting
questions.answer: To learn about traditional companion planting practices from local experts

questions.question: How can traditional ecological knowledge be integrated with modern agricultural science?
choices: By combining the best practices from both to create sustainable and resilient systems
By completely replacing traditional practices with modern techniques
By rejecting all modern scientific knowledge in favor of traditional methods
By keeping traditional and modern practices entirely separate
questions.answer: By combining the best practices from both to create sustainable and resilient systems

questions.question: What is a potential benefit of scaling up plant guilds and companion planting in Timor-Leste?
choices: Increased food security and agricultural resilience
Reduced crop diversity and ecosystem health
Higher dependence on external inputs and resources
Loss of traditional knowledge and cultural practices
questions.answer: Increased food security and agricultural resilience

questions.question: What is a key principle of designing plant guilds for a specific location?
choices: Selecting plants that are well-adapted to the local climate and soil conditions
Choosing plants based solely on their aesthetic value
Including as many exotic and introduced species as possible
Prioritizing the needs of the plants over the needs of the local community
questions.answer: Selecting plants that are well-adapted to the local climate and soil conditions

questions.question: How can plant guilds support the conservation of Timor-Leste's cultural heritage?
choices: By preserving traditional crop varieties and farming practices
By replacing traditional crops with modern, high-yielding varieties
By encouraging the use of chemical inputs and mechanization
By promoting the adoption of foreign agricultural practices
questions.answer: By preserving traditional crop varieties and farming practices

questions.question: What is the role of plant diversity in the resilience of Timorese agroecosystems?
choices: Diversity enhances the system's ability to withstand pests, diseases, and climate stress
Diversity makes the system more vulnerable to environmental challenges
Diversity has no impact on the resilience of the agroecosystem
Diversity is detrimental to the productivity and stability of the system
questions.answer: Diversity enhances the system's ability to withstand pests, diseases, and climate stress

questions.question: What is the significance of plant guilds and companion planting for Timor-Leste's food sovereignty?
choices: They promote locally adapted, diverse, and culturally appropriate food production
They increase dependence on imported seeds, inputs, and technologies
They undermine the ability of communities to make decisions about their food systems
They have no impact on food sovereignty and self-determination
questions.answer: They promote locally adapted, diverse, and culturally appropriate food production
